issue.title: Can't call ERC-20 transfer method using metamask
issue.body:
<!--

Steps before creating an issue: 

1. I've read the documentation.
2. I've tried googling or asking my question on stackoverflow.
3. I've tried searching this repository for similar issues.

-->

#### Expected behavior

#### Actual behavior

#### Steps to reproduce the behavior

i've spent four days on it checked different things and finally i found out i can't send any tx using web3js and metamask.
and got to use ethersjs and it works.
#### Logs

<!-- Please share any relevant logs that may help us debug your issue. -->

#### Environment

<!-- e.g. Versions used of: npm, Node, web3.js, OS, device -->

commits.message:
Fix TransactionInfoAPI type (#6539)

* fix tx type

* fix types. add withRequire type utility

* Revert "fix types. add withRequire type utility"

This reverts commit 4809d1d0ebceb0a7bf527315692a27ee64b7b05a.

* Revert "fix tx type"

This reverts commit 003e47259ac03bb3207dbe953526cb998d2ade86.

* fix types.

* fix integration test

* fix unit tests

* Update web3_eth_methods_with_parameters.test.ts

* fix

* fix build

* fix unit testscd

* add gasPrice. revert fixtures.

* revert fixture

* add changelog

* fix unit tests

issue.title: Insufficient funds for gas * price + value when migrating from 1.x to 4.x
Insufficient funds for gas * price + value when migrating from 1.x to 4.x

comment.body:
heyyy, I think I find the problem. You inspire me to use `const gas = await web3.eth.estimateGas(transaction)` for my transanction.  And the result is like
```
InvalidResponseError: Returned error: gas required exceeds allowance (0)
    at Web3RequestManager._processJsonRpcResponse (C:\Users\admin\Desktop\test\node_modules\web3-core\lib\commonjs\web3_request_manager.js:258:23)
    at Web3RequestManager.<anonymous> (C:\Users\admin\Desktop\test\node_modules\web3-core\lib\commonjs\web3_request_manager.js:156:29)
    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
    at fulfilled (C:\Users\admin\Desktop\test\node_modules\web3-core\lib\commonjs\web3_request_manager.js:21:58)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5) {
  innerError: { code: -32000, message: 'gas required exceeds allowance (0)' },
  code: 101,
  data: undefined,
  request: {
    jsonrpc: '2.0',
    id: 'eb0aafb6-4854-4eb9-9711-931f4f25bc98',
    method: 'eth_estimateGas',
    params: [ [Object], 'latest' ]
  }
}
```
my original code when defining a raw tx is 
```js
rawSellTx = {
    'nonce': web3.utils.toHex(accountNonce),
    'gasPrice': web3.utils.toHex("3100000001"),
    'gasLimit': web3.utils.toHex(3000000),
    'to': myRouterAddress,
    'value': web3.utils.toHex(0),
    'data': webMyRouter.methods.aaa(pcs, tokenAddress, liquidity).encodeABI()
}
```
It turns out that there is some change in `web3.utils.toHex` that cause this problem. In 1.X I use `console.log(web3.utils.toHex("3100000001"))`, but in 4.X we should use `console.log(web3.utils.toHex(3100000001))`  , the result are totally different when use `console.log(web3.utils.toHex("3100000001"))` in 4.X ,as it treat it as a string and get something like `0x33313030303030303031`.

Anyway, thanks for the inspiration. BTW may be an update in doc is needed as I didn't see this function in [migration guide](https://docs.web3js.org/guides/web3_upgrade_guide/x/web3_utils_migration_guide)

issue.title: Insufficient funds for gas * price + value when migrating from 1.x to 4.x

comment.body:
Hello @M0cK1nG-b1Rd ,
What is the value you get when you execute: `gas: await web3.eth.estimateGas(transaction)`?

[Generally we support Ethereum main net implementation and its test and dev nets. However, we will try to help you for this BSC transaction]
